NodeEditor

  • node_editor Module

node_editor Module

This module containing all window and widget class for node editor system (mouse event, history, clipboard).

exception GUI.node_editor.InvalidFile

Bases: Exception

class GUI.node_editor.Scene(width=8000, height=8000)

Bases: Serializable, object

Class representing NodeEditor’s Scene

Instance Attributes:

  • nodes - list of Nodes in this Scene

  • edges - list of Edges in this Scene

  • history - Instance of SceneHistory

  • clipboard - Instance of SceneClipboard

  • scene_width - width of this Scene in pixels

  • scene_height - height of this Scene in pixels

property has_been_modified

Has this Scene been modified?

Getter:

True if the Scene has been modified

Setter:

set new state. Triggers Has Been Modified event

Type:

bool

initUI()

Set up Graphics Scene Instance

getNodeByID(node_id)

Helper function to find node in the scene according to previous node_id

Parameters:

node_id (int) – ID of the node we are looking for

Returns:

Found Node or None

setSilentSelectionEvents(value=True)

Calling this can surpress onItemSelected events to be triggered. This is useful when working with clipboard

onItemSelected(silent=False)

Handle Item selection and trigger event Item Selected

Parameters:

silent (bool) – If True scene’s onItemSelected won’t be called and history stamp not stored

onItemsDeselected(silent=False)

Handle Items deselection and trigger event Items Deselected

Parameters:

silent (bool) – If True scene’s onItemsDeselected won’t be called and history stamp not stored

isModified()

Is this Scene dirty or has been modified ?

Returns:

True if Scene has been modified

Return type:

bool

getSelectedItems()

Returns currently selected Graphics Items

Returns:

list of QGraphicsItems

Return type:

list[QGraphicsItem]

doDeselectItems(silent=False)

Deselects everything in scene

Parameters:

silent (bool) – If True scene’s onItemDeselected won’t be called

addHasBeenModifiedListener(callback)

Register callback for Has Been Modified event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addItemSelectedListener(callback)

Register callback for Item Selected event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addItemDeselectedListener(callback)

Register callback for Items Deselected event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addDragEnterListener(callback)

Register callback for Drag Enter event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addDropListener(callback)

Register callback for Drop event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

resetLastSelectedStates()

Resets internal selected flags in all Nodes and Edges in the Scene

getView()

Shortcut for returning Scene QGraphicsView

Returns:

QGraphicsView attached to the Scene

Return type:

QGraphicsView

getItemAt(pos)

Shortcut for retrieving item at provided Scene position

Parameters:

pos (QPointF) – scene position

Returns:

Qt Graphics Item at scene position

Return type:

QGraphicsItem

addNode(node)

Add NodeConfig to this Scene

Parameters:

node (NodeConfig) – NodeConfig to be added to this Scene

addEdge(edge)

Add EdgeConfig to this Scene

Parameters:

edge – EdgeConfig to be added to this Scene

Returns:

EdgeConfig

removeNode(node)

Remove NodeConfig from this Scene

Parameters:

node (NodeConfig) – NodeConfig to be removed from this Scene

removeEdge(edge)

Remove EdgeConfig from this Scene

Parameters:

edge – EdgeConfig to be remove from this Scene

Returns:

EdgeConfig

clear()

Remove all Nodes from this Scene. This will also remove all related Edges

saveToFile(filename)

Save this Scene to the file on disk.

Parameters:

filename (str) – where to save this scene

loadFromFile(filename)

Load Scene from a file on disk

Parameters:

filename (str) – from what file to load the Scene

Raises:

InvalidFile if there was an error decoding JSON file

getEdgeClass()

Return the class representing Edge. Override me with custom edge type class if needed

setNodeClassSelector(class_selecting_function)

Set the function which decides what Node class to instantiate when deserializing Scene. If not set, we will always instantiate NodeConfig for each Node in the Scene

Parameters:

class_selecting_function (function) – function which returns Node class type (not instance) from Node serialized dict data

Returns:

Class Type of Node to be instantiated during deserialization

Return type:

Node class type

getNodeClassFromData(data)

Takes Node serialized data and determines which Node Class to instantiate according the description in the serialized Node

Parameters:

data (dict) – serialized Node object data

Returns:

Instance of Node class to be used in this Scene

Return type:

Node class instance

serialize()

Serialization method to serialize this class data into OrderedDict which can be easily stored in memory or file.

Returns:

data serialized in OrderedDict

Return type:

OrderedDict

deserialize(data, hashmap={}, restore_id=True)

Deserialization method which take data in python dict format with helping hashmap containing references to existing entities.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing serialized data

  • hashmap (dict) – Helper dictionary containing references (by id == key) to existing objects

  • restore_id (bool) – True if we are creating new Sockets. False is useful when loading existing Sockets of which we want to keep the existing object’s id.

Returns:

True if deserialization was successful, otherwise False

Return type:

bool

class GUI.node_editor.GraphicsScene(scene, parent=None)

Class representing Graphic of GraphicsScene

Overriden Qt’s dragMoveEvent to enable Qt’s Drag Events

Set width and height of the Graphics Scene

Draw background scene grid

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>
class GUI.node_editor.GraphicsView(scene_graphic, parent=None)

Bases: QGraphicsView

Class representing NodeEditor’s Graphics View

Parameters:

  • scene_graphic (GraphicsScene) – reference to the GraphicsScene

  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget

Instance Attributes:

  • scene_graphic - reference to the GraphicsScene

  • mode - state of the Graphics View

  • zoomInFactor- float - zoom step scaling, default 1.25

  • zoomClamp - bool - clamp zooming or limitless zooming

  • zoom - current zoom step

  • zoomStep - int - the relative zoom step when zooming in/out

  • zoomRange - [min, max]

scenePosChanged

Set up this QGraphicsView

Dispatch Qt’s mousePress event to corresponding function below

When Middle mouse button was pressed

middleMouseButtonReleaseEvent(event)

When Middle mouse button was released

leftMouseButtonPressEvent(event)

When Left mouse button was pressed

leftMouseButtonReleaseEvent(event)

When Left mouse button was released

rightMouseButtonPressEvent(event)

When Right mouse button was pressed

rightMouseButtonReleaseEvent(event)

When Right mouse button was release

mouseMoveEvent(event)

Overriden Qt’s mouseMoveEvent handling Scene/View logic

keyPressEvent(event)

Note

This overridden Qt’s method was used for handling key shortcuts, before we implemented proper QWindow with Actions and Menu. Still the commented code serves as an example on how to handle key presses without Qt’s framework for Actions and shortcuts. There is also an example on how to solve the problem when a Node contains Text/LineEdit and we press the Delete key (also serving to delete Node)

Parameters:

event (QKeyEvent) – Qt’s Key event

Returns:

cutIntersectingEdge()

Compare which Edges intersect with current Cut line and delete them safely

setSocketHighlights(scenepos, highlighted, radius)

set/disable socket highlights in scene area defined by scenepos and `radius

deleteSelected()

Shortcut for safe deleting every object selected in the Scene.

debug_modifiers(event)

Helper function get string if we hold Ctrl, Shift or Alt modifier keys

getItemAtClick(event)

Return the object on which we’ve clicked/release mouse button

Parameters:

event (QEvent) – Qt’s mouse or key event

Returns:

QGraphicsItem which the mouse event happened or None

wheelEvent(event)

overridden Qt’s wheelEvent. This handles zooming

isFilenameSet()

Do we have a graph loaded from file or are we creating a new one?

Returns:

True if filename is set. False if it is a new graph not yet saved to a file

Return type:

‘’bool’’

Returns:

bool

Returns:

bool

getUserFriendlyFilename()

Get user friendly filename (cut directory path). Used in the window title

Returns:

just a base name of the file or ‘New Graph’

Return type:

str

fileNew()

Empty the scene (create new file)

fileLoad(filename)

Load serialized graph from JSON file

Parameters:

filename (str) – file to load

fileSave(filename=None)

Save serialized graph to JSON file. When called with an empty parameter, we won’t store/remember the filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – file to store the graph

add_debug_content()

Testing method to put random QGraphicsItems and elements into QGraphicsScene

class GUI.node_editor.SceneHistory(scene)

Bases: object

Class contains all the code for undo/redo operations

Parameters:

scene (Scene) – Reference to the Scene

Instance Attributes:

  • scene - reference to the Scene

  • history_limit - number of history steps that can be stored

clear()

Reset the history stack

storeInitialHistoryStamp()

Helper function usually used when new or open file requested

addHistoryModifiedListener(callback)

Register callback for HistoryModified event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addHistoryStoredListener(callback)

Register callback for HistoryStored event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

addHistoryRestoredListener(callback)

Register callback for HistoryRestored event

Parameters:

callback – callback function

canUndo()

Return True if Undo is available for current History Stack

Return type:

bool

canRedo()

Return True if Redo is available for current History Stack

Return type:

bool

undo()

Undo operation

redo()

Redo operation

restoreHistory(operation)

Restore History Stamp from History stack.

Triggers:

  • History Modified event

  • History Restored event

storeHistory(desc, setModified=False)

Store History Stamp into History Stack

Parameters:

  • desc (str) – Description of current History Stamp

  • setModified (bool) – if True marks Scene with has_been_modified

Triggers:

  • History Modified

  • History Stored

captureCurrentSelection()

Create Dictionary with list of selected nodes and list of selected edges :return: dict nodes - list of selected nodes, edges - list of selected edges :rtype: dict

createHistoryStamp(desc)

Create History Stamp. Internally serialize whole scene and the current selection

Parameters:

desc – Descriptive label for the History Stamp

Returns:

History stamp serializing state of Scene and current selection

Return type:

dict

restoreHistoryStamp(history_stamp)

Restore History Stamp to current Scene with selection of items included

Parameters:

history_stamp (dict) – History Stamp to restore

class GUI.node_editor.SceneClipboard(scene)

Bases: object

Class contains all the code for serialization/deserialization from Clipboard

Parameters:

scene (Scene) – Reference to the Scene

Instance Attributes:

  • scene - reference to the Scene

serializeSelected(delete=False)

Serializes selected items in the Scene into OrderedDict

Parameters:

delete (bool) – True if you want to delete selected items after serialization. Useful for Cut operation

Returns:

Serialized data of current selection in NodeEditor Scene

deserializeFromClipboard(data)

Deserializes data from Clipboard.

Parameters:

data (dict) – dict data for deserialization to the Scene.
